Method Detail

readAllData

public static final String readAllData(InputStream input)
                                throws IOException
read all the data an ArcIMS Server response and present it as a single String. This strategy seems to work best with the Sun XML parser, when reading an AXl response because it cleanly separates the io component from the XML parsing component. This method also provides conversion to the appropriate encoding. The encoding is extracted from an xml header that should at beginning of the InputStream. If any encoding is not recognized, returned string will be formed in such way as if any character consists of one byte. The InputStream is closed after reading all the data.

IOException

writeAllData

public static final void writeAllData(OutputStream output,
                                      String theData,
                                      String encoding)
                               throws IOException
Writes the data from the given String to an OutputStream using the specified encoding. The OutputStream is closed after writing the data.

IOException
See Also:
readAllData(java.io.InputStream)

writeAllData

public static final void writeAllData(OutputStream output,
                                      String theData)
                               throws IOException
Writes the data from the given String to an OutputStream. The String is assumed to contain encoded data - all characters are assumed to be 8-bit. The OutputStream is closed after writing the data.

IOException
See Also:
readAllData(java.io.InputStream)

convertFromUnicodeEscapes

public static String convertFromUnicodeEscapes(String theString)
Converts the given String by decoding from unicode escapes.

See Also:
convertToUnicodeEscapes(java.lang.String)

convertToUnicodeEscapes

public static String convertToUnicodeEscapes(String theString)
Returns the given String by encoding all characters outside the range 0x0020..0x007F to unicode escapes.

Note: TAB, CR and LF are not converted. "\" is converted to "\\".

setProtocolProperties

public static void setProtocolProperties(Properties props)
Used to set the Protocol properties from a given properties object.
